hackathon-description-text: From October 13th - 15th, we are inviting up to 100 bright, entrepreneurial minds to take over Lighthouse Labs in Toronto and build, hack, design, and prototype projects around the theme of "National Disruption". The winning team will receive a spot at the Next 36 National Selection Weekend (for eligible team members) in December 2017, and there are plenty of other awesome prizes to be won. Stay tuned for more prizing announcements!
hackathon-rules:
This weekend is intended to provide a unique and superior learning experience for all participants. By participating in this event, you agree to come with a collaborative, open mindset, ready to learn and share ideas, and contribute to a valuable experience for all.
Our hackathon is dedicated to providing a harassment-free experience for everyone, regardless of gender, gender identity and expression, age, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, nationality, religion, previous hackathon attendance or computing experience (or lack of any of the aforementioned). We do not tolerate harassment of hackathon participants in any form.

This weekend is intended to provide a unique and superior learning experience for all participants. By participating in this event, you agree to come with a collaborative, open mindset, ready to learn and share ideas, and contribute to a valuable experience for all. All Startup Sprint projects must be original.

hackathon-description-header: Calling all makers, builders, designers, and innovators: this is your chance to disrupt the nation.
